heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

storm.status: No storms are expected.  The last storm was observed on 04 September 2025 and continued for 1 days.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwave.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwave.  This year has seen 6 heatwaves; typically, 1.9 heatwaves happen every year.

tropical: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (180°), which differs from the average south-westerly (234.0°) by approximately 54.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1754 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 8.4°C) and outside temperature (down 6.6°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 11%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 12516 lux) and cloud levels (up 929 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 14570 lux) and cloud levels (up 1275 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 929.4m lower than yesterday, 380.0m lower than the past week, 1275.1m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 835m to a maximum of 3910m, averaging 1255.9m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1635.8m and 2530m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: Cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; prepare for cold, chilly weather ahead. Also, dry air conditions likely prevail and little or no wind. Showers, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and it’s dark. The weather will likely remain the same.
